extDescription.message: Scrobble music all around the web!

optionsPermissionsLabel.message: You have not granted Web Scrobbler the permission to access all sites, which means you have to click the extension icon to start scrobbling every time. Click here to grant the permission. Note that in safari the permission will not automatically be granted, but the next time you visit a supported site you will be able to click "Always Allow on Every Website..." to grant the permission.

optionUseNotificationsTitle.message: Show now playing notifications for all supported websites

optionUnrecognizedNotifications.message: Notify if track is not recognized

optionUnrecognizedNotificationsTitle.message: Show notification if track is not recognized by the extension

optionUseInfoboxTitle.message: Show web scrobbler infobox on page for supported websites

optionAutoToggleLoveTitle.message: When you like or dislike a track on a website, the track will also be loved/unloved in your scrobbler

optionDebugLoggingEnabledTitle.message: Allow the extension to log debug messages to the browser console

optionAlbumGuessingDisabledTitle.message: Web Scrobbler will not guess the album title of any track

optionAlbumGuessingUneditedOnly.message: Only guess album for unedited tracks (default)

optionAlbumGuessingUneditedOnlyTitle.message: Web Scrobbler will only guess the album title of unedited tracks. Tracks with only bulk edits applied will still have album guessed

optionAlbumGuessingAllTracks.message: Guess album title for all tracks

optionAlbumGuessingAllTracksTitle.message: Web Scrobbler will guess the album title of all albumless tracks including edited ones

optionScrobbleRecognizedTracksTitle.message: Only scrobble tracks if they are recognized or edited

optionScrobbleEditedTracksOnlyTitle.message: Only scrobble tracks if they are edited

optionYtDesc.message: If you turn off both options, the extension will scrobble YouTube videos from all categories.

optionPercentDesc.message: Note that a track will be scrobbled anyway, if it has been played for 4 minutes, regardless of the option value.

optionYtMusicOnlyTitle.message: Ignore videos that are not in Music category

optionYtEntertainmentOnlyTitle.message: Ignore videos that are not in Entertainment category

optionYtGetTrackInfoFromYtMusic.message: Use Youtube Music to get track info

optionYtGetTrackInfoFromYtMusicTitle.message: Use Youtube Music to get track info, if disabled defaults to using description and video title

optionYtMusicRecognisedOnly.message: Scrobble only videos that are recognized by YouTube Music as music

optionYtMusicRecognisedOnlyTitle.message: Ignore videos that are not recognised by YouTube Music as music

optionThemeTitle.message: Choose the theme of the extension

optionsScrobbleCacheEditAll.message: Edit and scrobble all unscrobbled instances of this song
optionsScrobbleCacheEditAll.description: Label for checkbox to apply cache edit to all unscrobbled instances of the same track in cache.

optionsBlockedTagsDesc.message: This extension stores blocked artist/album/track tags.

optionsBlockedSourcesDesc.message: You can block scrobbling from specific sources such as channels on this website.

optionsEnableDisableHint.message: Click on the checkbox to enable/disable connectors.

optionsCustomPatternsHint.message: Click on the gear icon to configure custom URL patterns for connectors.
optionsCustomPatternsHint.description: Description of how to configure custom URL patterns

contactTwitterDesc.message: Keep up with the updates and for quick chat

faqQuestion1.message: How can I start using the extension?

faqAnswer1a.message: You should click on a notification that is shown when the extension is loaded the first time. Then, you should grant access to your accounts.

faqAnswer1b.message: Note: In some cases, the notification won't be shown, e.g. on Mac OS if Chrome is running in full-screen mode; the extension will open a tab where you can grant access to your accounts.

faqQuestion2.message: How do I temporarily disable scrobbling?

faqAnswer2a.message: You can do that by right-clicking on the green extension icon in the extension bar. Using the context menu you can disable the connector for the current web service.

faqAnswer2b.message: Use the checkboxes on the options page to disable certain connectors, or the "Toggle" checkbox to disable scrobbling globally.

faqQuestion3.message: The track was not recognized! Can you fix it?

faqAnswer3a.message: When a track cannot be recognized, a gray icon with question mark appears in the extension bar. You can click on this icon and input correct data in the opened popup window.

faqAnswer3b.message: Also, there's an option called "Force track recognition" that makes the extension force scrobbling the track even if the track is not validated by Last.fm.

faqQuestion4.message: Some music on Bandcamp cannot be scrobbled. Is it possible to fix this?

faqAnswer4a.message: Looks like the music is hosted on a custom domain and the extension cannot detect whether it’s Bandcamp or not.

faqAnswer4b.message: As a workaround, configure the extension to work with custom domains as follows:

faqAnswer4b1.message: Open the extension setting page and expand the “Options” section.

faqAnswer4b2.message: Find the Bandcamp connector in the list of supported services.

faqAnswer4b3.message: Click on the gear icon near the connector label.

faqAnswer4b4.message: Add URL pattern that matches the Bandcamp custom domain URL and apply the changes.

faqAnswer4c.message: You can learn more about the custom URL patterns here.

faqQuestion5.message: Will you add support for scrobbling at ____ ?

faqAnswer5.message: Open a new issue on GitHub with your request, and we'll tell you if we can add support for the website or not. Also, you can add support for the website by forking the GitHub repository and sending us a pull request.

faqAnswer6.message: Possibly, if it makes sense. But if you want me to add some not-that-useful-but-really-cool functions, you'll probably get disappointed.

faqAnswer7.message: The original author of this extension is David Šabata. Now this extension is developed and maintained by the Web Scrobbler Team.

aboutChangelog.message: The changelog of current version is available here. For the full changelog please visit this page.

aboutExtensionDesc.message: Web Scrobbler is a browser extension created for people who listen to music online through their browser, and would like to keep an updated playback history using scrobbling services, such as Last.fm, Libre.fm, ListenBrainz, and Pleroma.

contributorsText.message: You can find the list of contributors right on the GitHub

contributorsContribute.message: Want to contribute? See all the ways you can contribute to the project at our website.

showSomeLoveText1.message: Unlike other extensions, this one does not contain any flashing banners or sneaky ads.

showSomeLoveText2.message: The extension is free, and will always be free. But if you want to support development of the extension, you can use the button below.

customPatternsHint.message: Add URL patterns that the connector should match below.

buttonRemove.description: Remove button label, for removing a single scrobble from the cache

getStartedHeader.message: Play some music to get started

getStartedSiteChanged.message: In most cases this means the site has changed somehow. The change does not have to be visible to user, but means a lot to the extension.
getStartedSiteChanged.description: Description of why track is not recognized

getStartedSubmitIssue.message: The connector code for this specific website needs to be updated. You can navigate to the list of issues and see if this website is already reported. If it is not, you can submit a new issue describing what's wrong, what's expected behavior and what's happening instead.
getStartedSubmitIssue.description: Description of how to submit new issue

serviceErrorDesc.message: Looks like something went wrong while scrobbling the music. Please open the options page and try to reauthenticate with services. If reauthentication doesn't help, and you still see this message, please create a new issue at the GitHub project page.

disabledSiteDesc.message: The extension won't scrobble music from this website until you turn it on in the extension options.

disallowedHeader.message: This song is not being scrobbled

disallowedDesc1.message: Web Scrobbler has detected the song "$2" by "$1", but will not scrobble it.
disallowedDesc1.description: The description of 'disallowed' popup. $1 is the artist detected. $2 is the track detected

disallowedDescIsAd.message: The reason is that Web Scrobbler has detected this as being an ad.

disallowedDescForbiddenYouTubeCategory.message: You have disabled scrobbling youtube video categories other than music and/or entertainment, and this video is marked by the uploader as a different category. You can choose to scrobble any video category by disabling both "Scrobble videos from "Music" category" and "Scrobble videos from "Entertainment" category" in Web Scrobbler settings.

disallowedDescForbiddenTag.message: You have disabled scrobbling this artist, album, and/or track. You can re-enable tags in settings, or by hitting "Scrobble anyway" and re-enabling the tags in regex editing.

disallowedDescForbiddenChannel.message: You have disabled scrobbling this channel. You can re-enable it in connector settings, or by right clicking the extension icon and clicking "Enable scrobbling from <ID>".

disallowedDescNotOnYouTubeMusic.message: YouTube Music does not recognize this video as music, and you have enabled the option "Scrobble only videos that are recognized by YouTube Music as music" in settings.

disallowedDescIsPlayingElsewhere.message: The reason is that Web Scrobbler thinks this track is playing elsewhere and should not be scrobbled.

disallowedDescElementMissing.message: The reason is that some element Web Scrobbler relies on is not in the page. This probably means that either you are not playing music, or there is a bug in the connector.

disallowedDescFilteredTag.message: Either the artist, album, or track has been filtered by the connector as something that should not be scrobbled. This is not due to any setting you have set in your settings.

disallowedDescIsLoading.message: Something Web Scrobbler relies on for finding the track details is loading. Please wait a few seconds. If this message persists, please report it, as something is wrong.

disallowedDescOther.message: For some unknown reason, Web Scrobbler has determined this should not scrobble. This is not related to any setting you have set. If you believe this is an error, please report it.

disallowedDesc3.message: Web Scrobbler should still scrobble music from elsewhere on this website.
disallowedDesc3.description: The description of 'disallowed' popup on all sites including youtube

ignoredDesc.message: Web Scrobbler tried to scrobble "$2" by "$1", but the tags were ignored by Last.FM.
ignoredDesc.description: The description of 'ignored' popup. $1 is artist name, and $2 is track name

ignoredDescReadMore.message: Read more and ask for the song to be allowlisted here
ignoredDescReadMore.description: The description of 'ignored' popup, links to support.last.fm thread

unsupportedWebsiteDesc.message: Web Scrobbler does not support scrobbling from this website.

unsupportedWebsiteDesc2.message: Some Google websites supported by the extension (e.g. Google Play Music, YouTube) can be blocked due to an ExtensionSettings policy.

unsupportedWebsiteUpdateNote.message: If the extension recently updated sites may show as unsupported until you refresh the page.
